metadata.title: Endeavor Ridge Hot Vents Oceanic Processes, 1984-present
metadata.description: Part of an international program to study oceanic ridges, including sediment traps, current meters, and water properties.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Studying oceanic processes in the vicinity of hot vents.

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Some data not in regional data centre
Risk of Loss: Medium
Impact Justification: Long term time series (more than 10 years)
Impact of Loss: High
Recommended Action: Bring rest of data to archives

Status: In work

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: Private

Use constraints: Collaborative research with other institutions

Distribution liability: [unknown]

Native data set environment: Expected Growth Rate: Null

Data quality - Logical consistency: CTD data processed using normal IOS processing procedures. Normal standardization of CTD instruments at IOS.
Data quality - Completeness: Dataset Complications: The accuracy of the CTD data may vary depending on the instruments used and whether collaborating data were collected for intercomparison purposes.  Guildline CTDs are standardized at IOS; Sea-Bird CTD`s are calibrated at Sea-Bird Electronics in Bellevue, Washington.
Electronic Data Complications: Null
Lineage - Process steps:
  1. DFO, University of Washington, NOAA, University of Hawaii
